title: Two teenagers stabbed to death within five hours in London
text:
Two teenagers were stabbed to death within hours of each other as the ‘senseless attacks’ on London’s streets continue.

A 15-year-old boy was killed outside McDonalds in Stratford, east London, at about 3pm on Thursday.

Five hours later an 18-year-old was found with stab wounds near a children’s nursery in Brandon Estate, Camberwell, south London.

He died shortly later, the Metropolitan Police said.

His next of kin have been informed although formal identification has yet to take place and a post-mortem examination will be held in due course.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

In Stratford, the area around the 15-year-old boy was cordoned and a police forensic tent erected in front of the shopping centre.

Advertisement

Advertisement

One witness to the McDonald’s attack said: ‘At that moment there were not many people around him so I could see him all covered in blood. He was in pain and tried getting up.

‘There were people around gathering. It was scary as you did not know if any of them could have had a knife too.’

One stall worker saw paramedics trying to perform first aid to a ‘young guy’.

‘I saw police around here and one person was on the floor, I think they stabbed him,’ he said.

‘It was a young guy. He was a black guy on the floor. I think the ambulance guys tried to give him first aid.’

A murder investigation is underway following a stabbing in Camberwell (Picture: UKNIP)

A second boy, aged 15, was also stabbed outside McDonald’s. He was taken to an east London hospital, where his injuries are not thought to be life-threatening.

Police called the stabbings a ‘senseless attack’ as they called for witnesses to come forward.

Lead investigator Detective Chief Inspector Chris Soole said: ‘First and foremost our thoughts are with this young man’s family and friends.

‘They so tragically are having to come to terms with this terrible loss of life.

‘The victim of this stabbing was a schoolboy with his whole life ahead of him. He had everything to live for.’

No arrests have been made in either murder and police say they are not linked.

The deaths take the number of teenagers murdered in the capital this year to 23.

Advertisement

Advertisement

A total of 24 teenagers were murdered in London during the whole of 2018.

description: Two teenagers were stabbed to death within hours of each other as the 'senseless attacks' on London's streets continue. A 15-year-old boy was killed outside McDonalds in Stratford, east London,...
